arts.sum: The boss was buzzing after the big win and he made something clear

arts.ttl: Spirited Celtic fight back for first win of Europa League campaign
arts.sum: Second-half goals from Liam Scales and Benjamin Nygren saw Celtic come from behind to beat Sturm Graz 2-1 at Celtic Park as Brendan Rodgers' side recorded their first victory in this season's UEFA Europa League.

arts.ttl: CELTIC 2 STURM GRAZ 1: HEAD BHOY BENJI
arts.sum: CELTIC 2 STURM GRAZ 1 BENJAMIN NYGREN was Celtic’s head Bhoy as they came back to overcome spirited Austrians opponents at Parkhead tonight. It looked as though the Hoops were facing another Europe League embarrassment as they toiled 1-0 down at the interval and passed up a conveyor belt of chances. Nygren missed two good chances [...]

arts.ttl: Celtic vs Sturm Graz LIVE as Johnston and Engels start and that's not the only big surprise
arts.sum: The Hoops have no room for error with three points a must in a bid to salvage their European campaign

arts.ttl: SK Sturm Graz – A closer look at tonight’s visitors to Celtic Park
arts.sum: A closer look at SK Sturm Graz, a decent side but one with a poor away record in European football, much like ourselves… When Celtic welcome SK Sturm Graz to Celtic Park tonight, they’ll face one of Austria’s most disciplined and upwardly mobile sides, a team built on structure, alongside a strong team ethic… Sturm Read More

arts.ttl: Celtic vs Sturm Graz – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Celtic will be desperate to secure their first Europa League victory of the campaign when they host Austrian champions Sturm Graz at Celtic Park on Thursday evening. Both sides will be looking to climb the Europa League standings, with Celtic currently languishing in 28th position while Sturm Graz occupy 22nd place after two matchdays. arts.ttl: Celtic vs Sturm Graz – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Celtic will aim to claim their maiden Europa League win of the season when they welcome Austrian titleholders Sturm Graz to Celtic Park on Thursday night. arts.ttl: “I hoped we’d play Celtic away. The draw was kind. I’m incredibly excited,” Emir Karic
arts.sum: SK Sturm Graz defender Emir Karic revealed that he will be living out a childhood dream by playing at Celtic Park this evening, describing the venue as having one of the most electric atmospheres in Europe… Celtic continue their Europa League journey tonight as they face the Austrian champions in their third group stage match.
